title: Uncertainty of Quantum States
abstract:
The uncertainty of a quantum state is given by the composition of two
components. The first is called the quantum component and is given by the
probability distribution of an observable relative to the state. The second is
the classical component which is an uncertainty function that is applied to the
first component. We characterize uncertainty functions in terms of four axioms.
We then study four examples called variance, entropy, geometric and sine
uncertainty functions. The final section presents the general theory of state
uncertainty.
